page.title: 08RIVER DON INVERURIE
page.content:
The River Don flows through Inverurie on its way to Aberdeen, where it flows into the North Sea.
A tributary, the River Urie, meets the Don at Inverurie. Both rivers are popular with anglers. Trout are the main fish in the Urie, while salmon can be caught in the Don.
The Inverurie Bridge leads the traffic over the Don at the south end of the town. Below the bridge, on the banks of the river pathways have been laid out so that walks can be made along the riverside. A few benches have been set out along these pathways and many local people, as well as visitors, take advantage of these on warm summer days. Children enjoy swimming in the river near the bridge in summer.
